definitions.definition: A lash; a pliant, flexible instrument, such as a rod (commonly of cane or rattan) or a plaited or braided rope or thong (commonly of leather) used to create a sharp "crack" sound for directing or herding animals.
definitions.example: I had to use the whip to get the sheep's attention.

definitions.definition: A blow administered with a whip.
A whipper-in.
A member of a political party who is in charge of enforcing the party's policies in votes.
definitions.example: I was going to vote against the bill, but the party whip came to see me and made it clear I needed to vote for it.

definitions.definition: (UK politics, with definite article) A document distributed weekly to MPs by party whips informing them of upcoming votes in parliament.
Whipped cream.
definitions.example: Did you want to add some whip to your coffee, ma'am?

definitions.definition: A purchase in which one block is used to gain a 2:1 mechanical advantage.
A mode of personal motorized transportation; an automobile, all makes and models including motorcycles, excluding public transportation.
definitions.example: Come on, let's take my whip so we can get there in time.

definitions.definition: A move in which one player transfers momentum to another.
A whipping motion; a thrashing about.
definitions.example: I was startled by the whip of the rope when it finally snapped.

definitions.definition: The quality of being whiplike or flexible; suppleness, as of the shaft of a golf club.
Any of various pieces that operate with a quick vibratory motion
A coach driver; a coachman.
To hit with a whip.
(by extension) To hit with any flexible object.
definitions.example: I whipped her with a newspaper.

definitions.definition: To defeat, as in a contest or game.
To mix in a rapid aerating fashion, especially food.
To urge into action or obedience.
definitions.example: He whipped the department into shape.

definitions.definition: To enforce a member voting in accordance with party policy.
To bind the end of a rope with twine or other small stuff to prevent its unlaying: fraying or unravelling.
To hoist or purchase by means of a whip.
To sew lightly; specifically, to form (a fabric) into gathers by loosely overcasting the rolled edge and drawing up the thread.
To throw or kick an object at a high velocity.
definitions.example: He whipped the ball at me.

definitions.definition: To fish a body of water especially by making repeated casts.
To snap back and forth like a whip.
definitions.example: The pennants whipped in the wind.

definitions.definition: To move very fast.
definitions.example: The wind whipped through the valley.

definitions.definition: To move (something) very fast; often with up, out, etc.
To transfer momentum from one skater to another.
To lash with sarcasm, abuse, etc.
To thrash; to beat out, as grain, by striking.
